story:
Here's the candidate's career story:

After earning their Bachelor's in Psychology from Radford University and a Master's in Counseling Psychology, this professional made an interesting pivot into the HVAC construction industry, where they've built an impressive 14-year career in healthcare-focused sales and business development.

Their journey began in 2001 as a Healthcare Facility Specialist, where they pioneered a complete healthcare marketing program for Carrier. Their innovative approach and strong interpersonal skills led to remarkable results, including a half-million-dollar sale in their first year and a 100% increase in centrifugal chiller sales.

Building on this success, they advanced to become an Account Executive, specializing in Building Automation Systems. During this period, they excelled at developing new business relationships and marketing enterprise-wide control solutions. Their next role as Senior Sales Executive at Siemens Industry's Building Technologies Division allowed them to focus on new construction in healthcare, where they managed complex RFPs and strengthened relationships with mechanical contractors.

Most recently, as a Sales Associate at a healthcare mechanical contracting firm, they've continued to demonstrate their expertise in HVAC consultation, design, and installation. Their ability to build and maintain strong client relationships has resulted in developing four new major accounts.

Throughout their career, they've received numerous accolades from the Georgia Society for Hospital Engineers, including Vendor of the Year and the President's Award for Outstanding Service and Dedication. Their unique background in psychology, combined with their LEED Green Associate certification and expertise in CRM systems, has helped them excel in understanding client needs and delivering tailored solutions.

Their success story is built on a foundation of excellent communication, strategic partnership building, and a genuine passion for growing businesses through meaningful relationships in the healthcare sector.
